title: Did Michael Jackson write songs to other singers? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, he wrote and / or produced for others. 1974: What's Your Game (for M-D-L-T Willis, written and produced by The Jackson 5)1980: This Had to Be (for The Brothers Johnson, co-writer and backing vocals)1980: Night Time Lover (for La Toya Jackson, co-writer / producer and backing vocals)1981: Just Friends (for Carole Bayer Sager, producer and backing vocals)1982: Muscles (for Diana Ross, writer / producer and backing vocals)1983: Say Say Say (for Paul McCartney, co-writer and guest appearance)1983: The Man (for Paul McCartney, co-writer and guest appearance)1984: Love Never Felt So Good (for Johnny Mathis, co-writer; Michael recorded for himself in 1983; version of Michael solo, published on Xscape in 2014)1984: Behind the Mask (for Greg Phillinganes, co-writer / producer and rumored backing vocals; Michael recorded for himself in 1982; version of Michael solo, published on Michael in 2010)1984: Centipede (for Rebbie Jackson, writer / producer and backing vocals)1985: We are the World (for USA for Africa, co-writer and vocalist; version of Michael solo, published on The Ultimate Collection in 2004)1985: You're The One (for Jennifer Holliday, co-writer / producer)1985: Eaten Alive (for Diana Ross, co-writer / producer and backing vocals)1988: We Are Here To Change The World (for Dennis Williams, co-writer; Michael recorded for himself on Captain Eo in 1986; version of Michael solo, published on The Ultimate Collection in 2004)1988: K.I.S.S.I.N.G. (for Siedah Garrett, voice arranger)1990: Alright Now (for Ralph Tresvant, co-writer)1990: Do the Bartman (for The Simpsons; according to rumors co-writer / producer, but officially confirmed only backing vocals)1991: I Never Heard (for Sa-Fire, co-writer; Michael recorded for himself and Paul Anka in 1983; version of Michael solo entitled This Is It published on Michael Jackson's This Is It in 2009; original version of the duo, published on the album Paul Anka’s Duets in 2013)1992: To Satisfy You (for Bryan Loren, co-writer and backing vocals)1994: Joy (for BLACKstreet, co-writer)1995: Why (for 3T, producer and guest appearance)1995: Words Without Meaning (for 3T, producer)1997: Happy Birthday, Lisa (for The Simpsons, writer, credited as W.A. Mozart, sounds in episode 1 of season 3 The Simpsons in 1990)1998: Fly Away (for Rebbie Jackson, writer / producer and backing vocals; Michael recorded for himself in 1987; version of Michael solo, published on special edition Bad in 2001)1998: Children's Holiday (for J-Friends, co-writer / producer)1999: People Of the World (for J-Friends, co-writer / producer)2001: Woop-T-Woo (for Oliviva, co-writer; There’s little information about the song, so it can be questionable.)2003: What More Can I Give (for All Stars, writer / producer and vocalist; recorded in 2001)2003: Todo Para Ti (for All Stars, co-writer / producer and vocalist; spanish version What More Can I Give; recorded in 2001)2004: Your Love in My Life (for Colby O’Donis & Friends, producer)2011: All in Your Name (for Barry Gibb, co-writer and guest appearance; recorded in 2002)2014: There Must Be More To Life Than This (for Queen, producer original record and guest appearance; recorded in 1981)2018: Don't Matter to Me (for Drake, co-writer and virtual guest appearance; Michael recorded for himself in 1983, but gave up work on the song halfway)

Not that I'm aware of- in terms of his albums. He always gave a lot of credit to other musicians and artists of all kinds in interviews and at award shows. There were two instances when he wrote and performed two songs for two dear friends. The first was a song called “You Were There”. It was sung live by Michael at Sammy Davis Jrs 60th Anniversary Special in 1989. It was a beautiful and heartfelt song worth listening to. Sammy was touched greatly by it. The second song was also written and performed live by him. It was in honor of Elizabeth Taylor. It was called “Elizabeth, I Love You”. He performed it in 1997 at her 65th birthday celebration on ABC. As an adult, solo performer he didn't perform covers. The only song that I know of that he did renew was the Beatles song, “Come Together”. It was a very sexy and thrilling performance which is included in his Moonwalker film. But you can also watch it as an individual “video”. Let me know if you want me to put up the links for any of these. Enjoy!

Michael never sat down and composed songs for other people like what some artists like R Kelly, The Dream or Ne Yo do. If Michael is credited as one of the writers on a song he did not provide vocals for it means he was offered a song tried to work on it then rejected it. Like Blackstreet’s Joy. But he did seat down, wrote and produced Centipede for his sister Rebbie. Night Time Lover for La Toya.

If you meant if he wrote songs *for* other singers, he absolutely did! In particular he wrote "Muscles" and "Eaten Alive" for Diana Ross, "Centipede" for sister Rebbie, and "The Way You Love Me" was written for Hanson, though he just simply never delivered it to them. I know there are others, those are just the first ones I can think of off the top of my head.
Yes. He wrote a song to Rihanna. Don’t stop the music(2007)
